subject: How to test continuous changing  return value?
msgSnippet: hi all.I have a question in using junit ,can you help me ? say I have a class, PKGenerator,used to make primarykey for another entity class.see codes below:
messageBody:
hi all.I have a question in using junit ,can you help me ?

say I have a class, PKGenerator,used to make primarykey for another entity class.see codes below:

classs PKGenerator {
public int getPK(String EntityName){
int Result;
/ / load pk from some persistence,such as database
Result=loadPK(EntityName);
Result++;
/ / write it back
savePK(Result);
return Result;
}
.....................................
}
public class someEntity{
String thisName;
int PK;
String someValue;
public saveEntity{
PKGenerator PKGen=new PKGenerator();
PK=PKGen.getPK(thisName);
save(thisName,PK,someValue);
}
............................
}


/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
int PKGenerator.getPK(String EntityName) method will always return the highest PK value from some persistence,
so how should I write a testXXX that can always work?

I searched the document but didn't get answer,any help will be appreciated.
